instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.LCDBKLT_EN_L: What is LCDBKLT_EN_L? This signal enables the backlight when it is low.  _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be low to enable backlight. .
definitions.PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR: What is PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR? PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR is PPBUS_G3H after it has passed through a backlight fuse and a transistor that allows power through when BKLT_PLT_RST_L and LCD_BKLT_EN are present. .
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Hello Everybody

Working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem. no liquid damage ..

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_BLK</SIGNAL> 0V 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR</SIGNAL> 12.5V
<SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> 12.5V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> to ground resistance is 5.4 Mega ohm
<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> 3.3V

Also replaced , J8300,<TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>,L7710,<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>,<TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR>,<CHIP>U7701</CHIP>,<CHIP>U7750</CHIP>

Tested known good LCD, I can hear chime and see dark screen. Any idea for next step?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Did you check it with the correct LCD? 2012,13,14 will work on these for testing. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high?

threads.message: Yes [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] checked LCD its for 2012/13 and backlight is working also  another mac. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.3V

threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_PCH_DATA</SIGNAL> is 499Ohm ( Red probe ground at diode mode )
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_PCH_CLK</SIGNAL> is 500Ohm ( Red probe ground at diode mode )
same value is LCD connected and disconnected.

Voltage is 3.3V both line when machine running .

threads.message: Voltages on all pins of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. I can hardy believe this problem "just" happened. What is the history?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
If pin 6 has 5V what should be on pin 8? Although this is for KB bklt, there is something not right with that. I doubt this will cause issues with LCD bklt. 

Pins 15 and 16 are i2c bus, check for data on this bus with O-scope.
